summary: What It's REALLY Like to Wear a Marvel Superhero Costume (VIDEO)
title: What It's REALLY Like to Wear a Marvel Superhero Costume (VIDEO)
body:
What It’s REALLY Like to Wear a Marvel Superhero Costume (VIDEO)

During a recent interview about Ant-Man and The Wasp, Evangeline Lilly, who plays the film’s superhero Wasp, was asked about her suit.

While she wasn’t a big fan of needing to ask for help just to get out of her costume and go to the bathroom, she explained she loved.

“I love my suit. I think my suit is killer. I think my suit is so cool. I think it’s powerful. I think it’s modern and strong and…

View On WordPress

blog.name: hungrylittlemonster
blog.title: "LET'S DO SOMETHING FUN BEFORE WE DIE!"

title: ENGLISH PROJECT - PLEASE HELP
body:
For  my English exam this year we have to write and perform a speech about a topic we are interested in. The topic I have chosen is “How superheroes effect the world”. If possible would you be able to comment or pm me what superheroes mean to you. The effect that Wonder Woman or Black Panther had on you personally that I can include in my speech. Any of your opinions will help, even if they are negative. Also why you think the movies and comics have done so well. You can even talk about the community we have online. 


Thanks so much <3

blog.name: ao3feed-tonystark
blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

title: clockwork
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2tlDSWl

by MANIAvinyl

There’s something beautifully tragic about the way Tony Stark’s mind works— too fast and in all the wrong directions.

It’s like broken clockwork.

So when things start getting rough again, Tony doesn’t quite know who to turn to— or how.

Words: 2123, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Marvel Cinematic Universe, The Avengers (Marvel Movies)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: Other
  • Characters: Tony Stark, Steve Rogers, Colonel Rhodes
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark, Colonel Rhodes/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Tony Stark Needs a Hug, Tony Stark Has A Heart, PTSD, Anxiety, anxiety attack, Depression, Mental Illness, Tony Stark is not okay, Hurt/Comfort

read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2tlDSWl

summary: Avengers 4: Kevin Feige parla di quando verrà rivelato il titolo ufficiale
title: Avengers 4: Kevin Feige parla di quando verrà rivelato il titolo ufficiale
body:
Avengers 4: Kevin Feige parla di quando verrà rivelato il titolo ufficiale

Ci vorrà un po’ di tempo prima che il vero titolo di Avengers 4 diventi noto al pubblico. In vista dell’uscita di Avengers: Infinity War, i Marvel Studios hanno sostenuto che il film, girato insieme a Infinity War, sarebbe stato noto come “Untitled Avengers”, poi rinominato semplicemente Avengers 4, e questo almeno fino a poco dopo l’ uscita di Infinity War.

Qualcuno pensava che avremmo saputo il…

View On WordPress

summary: So I had a film literature class and one of the things we watched was the first season of Lost. And ever since Evangeline Lilly...
body: So I had a film literature class and one of the things we watched was the first season of Lost. And ever since Evangeline Lilly is one of my favorite actresses. So needless to say when I heard she’s the wasp I squealed…then I realized I was in a public place and some people were looking at me. BUT I’M STILL HAPPY ANYWAAAAY. 😃💕

summary: I don’t want to bother or offend you, but I have a dumb question about your url. Does it mean anything or like is it just two...
question: I don’t want to bother or offend you, but I have a dumb question about your url. Does it mean anything or like is it just two things you like? Does Jewishcap mean anything to you in particular or is it just like, not exactly a headcannon but something stronger than that for you? Anyway your content is A+ and I enjoy seeing you on my dash.
answer:
i was gonna answer with a flippant ‘steve rogers is jewish! :)’ but this is actually a really respectfully worded question and i’ll give it a serious answer haha.

on the one hand, yeah, i headcanon both steve and bucky as jewish. i think they’re jewish men and i think their stories are a lot more compelling when their faith is informing the way that they grew up & fought & made decisions as adults. a lot of their story – both steve’s and bucky’s – is laden with jewish themes from our culture and history, which brings me to my second point:

captain america as a concept was dreamed up by jack kirby and joe simon, two jewish men, and their longing for a superhero to punch hitler in the face and stand for american – specifically jewish immigrant american – values is in everything steve rogers does and is. even if you don’t think steve is jewish, you can’t strip the judaism out of his origin that kirby and simon poured into him.

captain america is inherently jewish. forgetting this is a disservice to his creators and his very jewish legacy, so here i am, loudly championing him.

i also want to be a good jewish man who stands up for what he believes in at any cost :)

title: Stevetony recs: Jarvis & the bots
body:
Who doesn’t love a good little robot friend? This month’s recs are for Steve/Tony stories featuring Jarvis and the bots (my secret favourite characters). Give our authors lots of love with comments and kudos!


Six Times DUM-E Made It Worse (and One Time He Fixed It) by FestiveFerret @festiveferret

DUM-E has a lot of Very Important jobs to do, and he does his best to do them right. Sometimes, though, things don’t work out very well.
All he wants is for his humans to be happy.

Rom-Commed By Fate (Or JARVIS) by leashy_bebes 

The best thing about being an Artificial Intelligence is the ability to parse, filter and modify the things people say until you’ve got the cause to do exactly what you wanted in the first place. Or, in which JARVIS cock blocks Tony into having an actual relationship.

The Act of Creation Will Be Your Salvation by scifigrl47

When Tony Stark was seventeen years old, he built his first AI.   On that day, he ceased to be his father’s creation, and became a creating force in his own right.
That one act likely saved his life, and not always in the most obvious ways.

Run Program: DUM-E by Amuly

Taking care of Tony is a lot of work. Especially when you’ve only got one arm. And your code dates back to the 1980s.

“death by coffee” and other search queries by goodmorningbeloved  @goodmorningbeloved

In which Steve’s feelings are hopelessly obvious through his Google searches. JARVIS decides to step in.

For You, Sir, Always (The Fairy Godfather Remix) by Veldeia

Unable to find a replacement for the toxic palladium core of his arc reactor, Sir has gone into cryostasis to wait for a day when science has advanced enough to provide a solution. While he is indisposed, it is my all-important task to decide when that time has arrived, and to select the person who shall bring him back to life.

Peer-Reviewed by  MountainRose, szzzt

Tony Stark is all about the advancement of science, but…he probably should have clued Steve in a little sooner.
Steve just thinks it’s a bad idea to volunteer for anything that involves Reed Richards.

Safeword by melannen

Tony Stark doesn’t need to be safe, sane, and consensual. He has JARVIS instead. (Then he gets Steve.)


Bonus section! Cute gen fics featuring Tony and his bots:

The Butterfingers G. D. I. Stark Guide to Problem Solving by Epiphanyx7

Tony begins to notice that things are going missing from his workshop… and discovers that his bots have been hiding a very, very big secret from him. Or rather, a very, very small one.

Unauthorized Access by Del_Rion

In the chaos following the Battle of New York, the job including a break-in into Stark Tower should be an easy one – in theory.

4.6 by everythingispoetry

It hurts when the suit plugs into his arc reactor.
If no one is looking, Sir closes his eyes tightly every time he puts on a suit.

A Future Shining by icarus_chained

It took Tony a while to notice. To see the increasingly massive sections of memory space that someone had blocked off in JARVIS’ systems, the processing power being diverted to something that … that Tony couldn’t breach.


Double bonus! I wrote a Steve/Tony fic about Jarvis too:

System ID: J.A.R.V.I.S. by cptxrogers

After Civil War, Tony is struggling with heading up the team and dealing with the emotional fallout of being betrayed by those closest to him. Luckily, an old friend is back to help protect Tony and ensure he comes to no harm.

A Jarvis lives AU.

Tony Stark is all about the advancement of science, but…he probably should have clued Steve in a little sooner.
Steve just thinks it’s a bad idea to volunteer for anything that involves Reed Richards.

Safeword by melannen

Tony Stark doesn’t need to be safe, sane, and consensual. He has JARVIS instead. (Then he gets Steve.)


Bonus section! Cute gen fics featuring Tony and his bots:

The Butterfingers G. D. I. Stark Guide to Problem Solving by Epiphanyx7

Tony begins to notice that things are going missing from his workshop… and discovers that his bots have been hiding a very, very big secret from him. Or rather, a very, very small one.

Unauthorized Access by Del_Rion

In the chaos following the Battle of New York, the job including a break-in into Stark Tower should be an easy one – in theory.

4.6 by everythingispoetry

It hurts when the suit plugs into his arc reactor.
If no one is looking, Sir closes his eyes tightly every time he puts on a suit.

A Future Shining by icarus_chained

It took Tony a while to notice. To see the increasingly massive sections of memory space that someone had blocked off in JARVIS’ systems, the processing power being diverted to something that … that Tony couldn’t breach.


Double bonus! I wrote a Steve/Tony fic about Jarvis too:

System ID: J.A.R.V.I.S. by cptxrogers

After Civil War, Tony is struggling with heading up the team and dealing with the emotional fallout of being betrayed by those closest to him. Luckily, an old friend is back to help protect Tony and ensure he comes to no harm.

A Jarvis lives AU.
trail.content:
Who doesn’t love a good little robot friend? This month’s recs are for Steve/Tony stories featuring Jarvis and the bots (my secret favourite characters). Give our authors lots of love with comments and kudos!


Six Times DUM-E Made It Worse (and One Time He Fixed It) by FestiveFerret @festiveferret

DUM-E has a lot of Very Important jobs to do, and he does his best to do them right. Sometimes, though, things don’t work out very well.
All he wants is for his humans to be happy.

Rom-Commed By Fate (Or JARVIS) by leashy_bebes 

The best thing about being an Artificial Intelligence is the ability to parse, filter and modify the things people say until you’ve got the cause to do exactly what you wanted in the first place. Or, in which JARVIS cock blocks Tony into having an actual relationship.

The Act of Creation Will Be Your Salvation by scifigrl47

When Tony Stark was seventeen years old, he built his first AI.   On that day, he ceased to be his father’s creation, and became a creating force in his own right.
That one act likely saved his life, and not always in the most obvious ways.

Run Program: DUM-E by Amuly

Taking care of Tony is a lot of work. Especially when you’ve only got one arm. And your code dates back to the 1980s.

“death by coffee” and other search queries by goodmorningbeloved  @goodmorningbeloved

In which Steve’s feelings are hopelessly obvious through his Google searches. JARVIS decides to step in.

For You, Sir, Always (The Fairy Godfather Remix) by Veldeia

Unable to find a replacement for the toxic palladium core of his arc reactor, Sir has gone into cryostasis to wait for a day when science has advanced enough to provide a solution. While he is indisposed, it is my all-important task to decide when that time has arrived, and to select the person who shall bring him back to life.

Peer-Reviewed by  MountainRose, szzzt

Tony Stark is all about the advancement of science, but…he probably should have clued Steve in a little sooner.
Steve just thinks it’s a bad idea to volunteer for anything that involves Reed Richards.

Safeword by melannen

Tony Stark doesn’t need to be safe, sane, and consensual. He has JARVIS instead. (Then he gets Steve.)


Bonus section! Cute gen fics featuring Tony and his bots:

The Butterfingers G. D. I. Stark Guide to Problem Solving by Epiphanyx7

Tony begins to notice that things are going missing from his workshop… and discovers that his bots have been hiding a very, very big secret from him. Or rather, a very, very small one.

Unauthorized Access by Del_Rion

In the chaos following the Battle of New York, the job including a break-in into Stark Tower should be an easy one – in theory.

4.6 by everythingispoetry

It hurts when the suit plugs into his arc reactor.
If no one is looking, Sir closes his eyes tightly every time he puts on a suit.

A Future Shining by icarus_chained

It took Tony a while to notice. To see the increasingly massive sections of memory space that someone had blocked off in JARVIS’ systems, the processing power being diverted to something that … that Tony couldn’t breach.


Double bonus! I wrote a Steve/Tony fic about Jarvis too:

System ID: J.A.R.V.I.S. by cptxrogers

After Civil War, Tony is struggling with heading up the team and dealing with the emotional fallout of being betrayed by those closest to him. Luckily, an old friend is back to help protect Tony and ensure he comes to no harm.

A Jarvis lives AU.

blog.name: gabriel-movies
blog.title: Gâbrïel's movie blog
blog.description: For in depth film analysis and commentary (My other blogs are "gabriel-general" and "gabriel-artwork")

summary: Why Marvel Movies Work (or why DC Movies don’t)
title: Why Marvel Movies Work (or why DC Movies don’t)
body:
I’m sure every single one of you have seen a billion videos explaining why DC comic book movies aren’t as good as Marvel movies. From poorly constructed fight scenes, to bad dialogue, everyone seems to have a list of reasons why DC doesn’t work. But as I was watching The winter soldier yesterday I realised why marvel works so well from a story standpoint and why DC doesn’t, at least from a story standpoint. 

The scene I remember is at the end. Bucky is standing over Captain America, beating him down and trying to deny his memories of WW2 to keep his façade of the winter soldier. Angry and confused he stands above the weak and injured body of Steve Rogers, debating with himself if his loyalty to hydra or his friendship is more important.  I remember the first time I watched this scene I thought it was cool but I didn’t think it was anything crazy, but watching it back a second time after watching the other movies that came after I suddenly felt myself feeling all emotional after this scene. 

This is why Marvel works, their character arcs. A lot of people say that a film is bad when it sets up for sequels instead of telling its own stories, but I think that what they mean is that a film is bad when instead of setting up an emotional arc or question for the sequel, it just sets up plot points or characters, which marvel avoids by putting those kinds of teasers in end credit scenes. In their movies they allow their characters to grow and develop more than they would be able to in a 2 hour movie. This is why I found the scene more emotional, I’d seen Bucky and cap grow closer as friends (and possible lovers) in Civil War and Infinity War and it means that when I go back to watch the other films it makes it all the more rewarding. 

This pattern happens all across Marvels cinematic timeline. From watching Tony Star grow from a narsasitc selfish arms dealer to a selfless paranoid hero, watching Scott Lang going from a desperate thief to a lovable dumbass willing to fight for what’s right, and even Gamora going from brooding assassin to member of a caring family. 

Now for comparison let’s take a look at DC. I know it’s still early in the lifespan of the DCEU but there is a noticeable absence of character development between films. When I go back to watch Man of Steel, nothing about Superman’s character arc feels like it’s leading anywhere in future films, I just notice “Oh hay, there’s Bruce Wayne’s satellite, He turns up later”. When I watch Batman VS Superman, I don’t think about how superman’s character has progressed since the first film, I just see “oh, there’s a video with the justice league”. See what I’m getting at here? this is bad universe building, more concerned with setting up sequels and characters than doing what Cinematic universes can do the best, allow for massive character development. 

Now admittedly DC still has time to improve, they are making more films and the characters still have room to progress, but if they just wanna build a cinematic universe to cramp a bunch of heroes in rather than developing them, they should probably just stick to singular films. Take a hint from Marvel and save the teasers for the end credits. 

(been thinking about this one a while. I wanted to give my opinion on the marvel VS dc debate. Admittedly I do like DC movies more than most people do, I was one of the few people who enjoyed suicide squad, but I’m not so blind I can’t see the flaws with the DCEU, so I hoped you enjoyed it)

blog.name: super-hero-confessions
blog.title: Super-Hero-Confessions
blog.description:
Super-hero-confessions is a blog where you can submit your confessions/personal opinions about any of the super hero movies, comics, television shows, cartoons, etc.

The confessions that are posted are those that are submitted; not the opinions of the blog owners. All the confessions will be anonymous when posted. Feel free to submit photos along with your confession if you would like as well.

If you want us to see a post tag it with either #superheroconfessions or #superhero confessions

summary: Okay, it’s gotten out of hand
body:
Okay, it’s gotten out of hand

Stop sending hate, death threats, ectectect, to the girl from the whole ace Comic-Con thing. I get your mad about the whole thing but that’s no reason to be harsh. She thought she was being funny but it didn’t come off that way. I’m sure she meant no harm or to be rude.

summary: Smithsonian Museum To Add a 'Black Panther' Exhibit - Wakanda Forever!
title: Smithsonian Museum To Add a 'Black Panther' Exhibit - Wakanda Forever!
body:
Smithsonian Museum To Add a ‘Black Panther’ Exhibit – Wakanda Forever!

To celebrate the success of Marvel’s Black Panther, the Smithsonian’s National Museum of African American History and Culture recently announced a new display dedicated to the new movie.

The museum will be displaying props from the film into its exhibition. In a statement, the museum explained that the 2018 blockbuster “illustrates the progression of blacks in film, an industry that in the past…

View On WordPress
